article.headline: Iona 78, Rider 63
article.story: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y. (AP) -- Greg Jenkins scored 18 points and Anthony Bruin added 15 to help Iona snap a five-game losing streak with a 78-63 victory Tuesday night over Rider. Iona (8-17, 6-10 Metro Atlantic Athletic) led 33-30 at the break before cracking open the game with a 17-5 spurt to begin the second half. Bruin, a freshman forward, produced seven of his points during that stretch. Jenkins capped the spree with a dunk that created a 50-35 margin with 13 minutes left. Jenkins and Bruin had 10 rebounds apiece to help the Gaels to a 51-37 margin on the boards. Iona hit 33 of its 69 shots (47.8 percent) to 22 of 65 for the Rider (33.8 percent). Reserve Terrance Mouton led Rider (15-12, 9-7) with 16 points. Ricky Soliver added 13 points for Iona while Marvin McCullough and Kiril Wachsmann had in 11 and 10, respectively. The Gaels pulled away to lead by as many as 20 points, the first time at 74-54 on Steve Burtt's two foul shots with 2:08 left.
